name: Carousel Resort Hotel & Condominiums

reviews.title: Not Recommendable! Not Worth The Price!
reviews.text: VERY DISAPPOINTING! NOT WORTH IT AT ALL! We reserved on-line (and confirmed by a return e-mail) a $250/night oceanfront 2-queenbed plus sleeper sofa room. Upon check-in, we were given instead a 1-kingsize plus sleeper room on the first floor with a no-privacy patio that was next to a noisy and crowded kiddie pool, with no-ocean view. The hotel should say on its website that ground-floor oceanfront rooms in the hotel were pool/pool-bar view only. We asked to be moved to a higher- floor for patio-privacy and good view of the ocean, but was unsympathetically denied by the reception desk. Hotel staff was not friendly and helpful, pizza in the atrium tasted like it was stored in the freezer for months, the starback coffee was washed down with water, the arcade had outdated video games, the smell of the indoor pool was unusally strong, the atrium was loud and noisy, and food in the breakfast atrium and Seasons Restaurant was horrible! For the price we paid, we were better off getting a non-ocean front room in some other 3-star hotel! Definitely not to be recommended to friends.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where o where to begin..............
reviews.title: The Worst I Have Ever Been to

likes.liked: — the bar and snack bar outside

reviews.text: * Dinner at the hotel was an absolute nightmare. The waiter either quit or was fired. we sat at our table for almost an hour. as we were about to leave someone came to us and apologized.
reviews.title: Would not recommend for the money
Perfect for children!!
reviews.text: The martini was asked with lemon twist, was served w / a lemon wedge, there-fore martini with lemonade. Yy wife ordered lobster, served with burned broccoli, potato floating in water, could ot eat veg. no loboster fork given, had to fight with table fork an knife. Raw oysters, ordered 6 gave twelve, were warm, not served on ice, did not eat, not sure it was good. on top of all this they billed us for the returned drinks and the extra oysters not ordered. Breakfast, eggs were to be sunny up and were raw.

Ceiling plaster was falling on thhe bed, kids up stairs were throwing water on every one down below and could not sit on balcony. The lamp was partially disassembeled and if a child touched it .... good-by. The bathroon mirror, when you showered steamed up, of course, and behold, there displayed what looked like semen was on the mirror.
reviews.title: Resort prices for motel styled rooms

likes.liked: — the room was clean, Thank God

reviews.text: Unfourtanatly I did not read the reviews on here before staying, although I probably still would have stayed here since our friends were already booked in the same hotel. This was the kind of place where I got a bad feeling right from the start. It looked old , run down and creepy from the outside. The lobby was similar, and very noisy with kids running everywhere. We got to the hotel around 1 pm , and checked in with a women who was quite unfriendy. She said check-in time was 4pm ( in a very snappy way) and made almost no attempt to see if any room was available or to try to make on avialable. I cant ever remember the last time I was not able to check into a hotel after 1pm, especially one this large. But thats ok, I can deal with that. We came back around 4pm to check back in and were told our room was ready. I had paid an extra 30.00 for an ocean view room, and was given a room on the first floor with a view of a concrete wall and a closed down tiki bar. Real nice. Not to mention the fact that to get to our room you have to drag your stuff through the crowded ice rink . Our room was located about 3 feet from where people congregate before getting on the ice.. it could not have been in a worse location. I went back in to the front desk and ecountered the same rude women who told me there was no way to change my room, which was an obvious lie. She just had no desire to do it. The buffet looked horrible, and our friends confirmed that after trying it for breakfast. I really didnt see any redeeming quality about this place. Every aspect of it was subpar.
reviews.title: Tripadvisor reviews got this one right... it stinks.

likes.disliked: — Rudeness, and indifference of staff --and children screaming all day.

reviews.text: Take my advice and try somewhere else. The only people I could ever see enjoying this place are familes with small children who love to ice skate. Thats about it.
reviews.title: Big Let Down

likes.liked: — We had a two room suite, reasonably priced
likes.disliked: — End of season the hotel was not well staffed, unfriendly staff

reviews.text: This was our second stay. We rented a condo for a week one summer which was great. This vacation was an end of beach season weekend. We picked this hotel for the indoor pool and indoor ice skating. Not only was everything in the hotel barely open, the skating rink was closed starting Sunday. No one told us. When I complained to the front desk that no one told us and that we missed our chance to skate because we did other activities Saturday, the manager couldn't have care less. Not even an apology. This may be a great summer vacation, but for a fall stay, they don't care. It is almost like they want you to go home so they can close! If you need to extend check out time, forget it. They charge a half day rate even when the hotel is empty. This was our last stay.
reviews.title: Family Friendly but Hotel needs a Face Lift

likes.liked: — The snack bar, skating rink and pools.

reviews.text: We booked the Carousel Hotel after leaving another hotel in Ocean City which was horrible. We were very satisfied with the Carousel. The staff was very courteous and helpful to us. The room needed a facelift and the furniture was very 70's. However, the room and bathroom were both clean which was very important. We always saw a staff memeber cleaning some part of the hotel at all times. We loved the little snack stand/ice cream bar in the lobby. It gave us the option of having a bagel or donut in the morning. We also really liked the patio grill by the beach. We loved getting hot dogs their for lunch. Both the indoor and outdoor pool were clean and well kept. The skating rink was a great feature. The beach area was very crowded probably because the Carousel was surrounded by other large hotels/condos. The room was very expensive, but the hotel itself had a lot of appeal -- it just needs a face lift.
reviews.title: We had a pleasant Condo experience

likes.disliked: — carpet had a funky smell, livingroom furniture was pretty old/used, mattresses were saggy

reviews.text: Let me start by saying that AFTER we booked our vacation I saw all of these horrible reviews online and was convinced that we were going to have a horrible stay. But then, I thought, most people who have complaints post their feelings as opposed to those who had a pleasant experience. This is our story...
reviews.title: Carousel - Worst Hotel Ever !!!
Nice for kids, but you should know . . .
reviews.text: We spent three days at the Carousel Hotel and found it to be a very nice family resort hotel. There is a coffee and ice-cream shop in the atrium, an outdoor bar and grill between the hotel and the beach and a reasonably-priced restaurant in the hotel. The pools and outdoor area (with very nice playground) are beautifully maintained. It's only steps to the beach, and all lifeguard stands were staffed. Parking can be tough in Ocean City, but between the large lot and indoor garage, parking during our time was plentiful. The stay was nice and, although we did, there was little need to leave the hotel for anything..

reviews.title: Not happy with the Carousel
reviews.text: While our experience was positive, it's only fair to point out the not-so-positive things. When we made a reservation for an ocean-front room, the reservationist said that she should point out that the ocean view from our first-floor room would be partially blocked by dunes. What she didn't point out was that the dunes were blocked by an outdoor restaurant and tiki bar, with tables no more than eight feet from our patio door. The umbrella tables were so close to our room, that during a brief storm, the wind knocked one of the tables on its side, hitting our door. Sitting on a chair on our patio, we had people at the closest table no more than three feet away. The other door to the room opened directly into the activity in the atrium. At one point, the theme from "Space Odyssey" from the front door and the sounds of a duo performing "Rollin' Down the River" from the patio door were a cacophony so loud that we couldn't hear each other talking in our room. All we could do was laugh. The point is, don't take a first-floor room if you want privacy and to watch the quiet ocean.

There have been a number of reviews about service and cleanliness at this hotel. Our experience was that the the room and grounds appeared clean. The hotel did seem to be short staffed, and a number of them had difficulty with English, but those who were there were friendly and helpful. There should be no major complaints for guests who are self-sufficient, but if you're looking for a luxury, high-end hotel, with personalized service, this is not the place.
reviews.title: Good Value, good time

reviews.text: If we were looking for fun excursion, would we stay at the Carousel again? Yes. It's an entertaining, very affordable getaway.
reviews.title: High Cost - Little Service!

reviews.text: Requested non smoking ocean front six months in advance of arrival.
reviews.title: Very dirty carpets, not treated well

reviews.text: This hotel has the potential for being a great hotel. The view from the oceanfront rooms is beautiful, but the rooms are in very bad shape. The carpet is worn and stained, the furniture is old and falling apart, the mattresses are terrible, and the bathrooms are poor at best. I would say it has been at least 10 years since this hotel has been refurbished and updated. The first night we had water flooding into our bathroom, apparently from the bathroom above us, and at 6am in the morning it took two calls to the front desk and 45 minutes before I could get anyone to come up and stop the water flow. The staff is poorly trained in customer service and don't really seem to care about the guests at all. Basically, there is no customer service. The two redeeming factors about this hotel are the oceanfront view and the patio grill. Will not go back to this hotel....way over priced for the extremely poor conditios.
reviews.title: Terrible, way over priced

reviews.text: What a great family-friendly hotel to stay at - you just can't
reviews.title: Relax'n At The Carousel
great place- going back
reviews.text: get any closer to the beach. The staff was friendly and
the hotel had everything you needed. The ice skating rink is such a unique addition to the hotel's ammenities. There is an
reviews.title: Never Again
Too old, too expensive, terrible
reviews.text: ice skating show nightly - FUN TO WATCH. The hotel has live musicians singing and playing by the outdoor pool - FUN AND UPBEAT. I do not travel to Ocean City on a regular basis, but I would definitely make the Carousel my place to stay in Ocean City in the future.

description: Your family can enjoy a tradition of fun and relaxation at one of Ocean City Maryland's most popular family resorts. Come join us on our famous Ice skating rink or relax in our spacious atrium. Kick back and enjoy our beach patio with live music, exceptional Ocean City cuisine, and sip a frozen cocktail as you lounge beach side. Drop the kids off for ice skating and relax in our indoor pool, hot tub, or sauna. No matter what your expectations are for an ideal family vacation in Ocean City Maryland, Carousel has it all. We are Ocean City Maryland's favorite family resort!
